Protected Attributes

Ogre::Camera * Cam
 This is the Camera used by the graphics Subsystem, that this class wraps.
CameraManager * CamManager
 This is the Camera manager that this camera is attached to.

Detailed Description

This is the camera class.

This class contains all the functionality needed to manipulate an individual camera that has been created.

Ray phys::Camera::GetCameraToViewportRay ( Real  Screenx,
Real  Screeny 
)

Gets a Ray from the camera to the viewport.

This will cast a ray from the camera to the viewport and return it.

Parameters:
Screenx A Real representing the relative location on screen, on the x axis(0.0-1.0).
Screeny A Real representing the relative location on screen, on the y axis(0.0-1.0).

void phys::Camera::ResetZoom (  ) 

Resets the zoom level back to the default.

This function will return the zoom level back to normal. Note this function will only work if the camera is attached to a node.

void phys::Camera::SetAspectRatio ( Real  Ratio  ) 

Sets the aspect ratio of the cameras veiw.

This function will set the aspect ratio between the width and height of the cameras viewing area.

Parameters:
Ratio A Real that represents the aspect ratio, where Ratio = width / height.

String  Target

Enables or disables auto tracking for the camera.

This function can enable auto tracking of a given node you have created.

Parameters:

Definition at line 120 of file camera.cpp.

void phys::Camera::SetAutoTracking ( bool  Enabled,
String  Target,
Vector3  Offset 
)

Enables or disables auto tracking for the camera.

This function can enable auto tracking of a given node you have created.

Parameters:
Enabled Bool value to enable or disable auto tracking for this camera.
Target Name of the node to be tracked.
Offset The offset of where the camera is to look from the target. I.E. Always 5 units ahead, etc..

void phys::Camera::SetFarClipDistance ( Real  FarDist  ) 

Sets the long range clip distance.

Sets the distance at which objects are considered too far to render.

Parameters:
FarDist A Real representing the distance. Note: This number directly corolates to the dimentions you provide in the constructor for the physgame. You should understand your games scale before setting this number.

void phys::Camera::SetFixedYawAxis ( bool  UseFixed  ) 

Sets whether to lock rotation around the Y axis.

This function will lock rotations around the Y axis. This function is automatically called on by the camera constructor.

Parameters:
UseFixed Enable or disable the locking of the axis.

Definition at line 109 of file camera.cpp.

void phys::Camera::SetFixedYawAxis ( bool  UseFixed,
Vector3  Axis 
)

Sets whether to lock rotation around the Y axis.

This function will lock rotations around the Y axis (or another axis if you specify). This function is automatically called on by the camera constructor.

Parameters:
UseFixed Enable or disable the locking of the axis.
Axis The axis to lock, defaults to the Y axis.
